pageContext.claim: “I've issued a historic executive order, stating that any college that refuses to let you -- meaning you, but anybody -- speak, stands to lose billions and billions of taxpayer dollar. We give them all of this money, and then they don't let you speak. Well, we just ended that.”
pageContext.analysis: This is exaggerated. Executive orders cannot overwrite appropriations passed by Congress, such as funding for higher education institutions. Trump's executive order "does not, on its face, make dramatic changes," The Washington Post reported.
